required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Coating to Optimize Aneurysm Treatment In The New Flow Diverter Generation
clinical_study.official_title: Coating to Optimize Aneurysm Treatment In The New Flow Diverter Generation

brief_summary.textblock: To assess safety and efficacy of p48/p64 MW HPC Flow Modulation Device under single antiplatelet therapy compared to p48/p64 MW Flow Modulation Device under dual antiplatelet therapy.

primary_outcome.description: Number of diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI) lesions within 48 hours (+/- 24 hours) of the index procedure visualized via MRI.

secondary_outcome.description: Morbi-mortality rate at 30 days assessed by mRS > 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of neurological death or major stroke
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of neurological death or major stroke (ischemic or hemorrhagic, defined as an increase of 4 or more points according to the National Institute of Health Stroke Scale Score) in the territory supplied by the treated artery, as assessed by the Clinical Events Committee

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of subjects who have a mRS decline to a score of 3 or more (mRS > 3), or an increase of 2 points from baseline mRS score, as assessed by the Clinical Events Committee

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of subjects with dissusion-weighted imaging (DWI) lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of subjects with greater than 6 diffusion-weighted imaging (DWI) lesions or territorial stroke

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of an intracranial hemorrhage from delayed aneurysm rupture (from the day after index procedure), as assessed by the Clinical Events Committee

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of delayed intraparenchymal haemorrhage unrelated to aneurysm rupture, as assessed by the Clinical Events Committee

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of device deployment at the target site without technical complications
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of device deployment at the target site without technical complications, as assessed by the site

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of complete aneurysm occlusion using the 3-grade scale, as assessed by the Core Lab

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of target aneurysm recurrence, as assessed by the Imaging Core Lab

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of target aneurysm retreatment, as assessed by the Clinical Event Committee

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of intrastent stenosis and/or thrombosis at the target site
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 180 days (± 30 days) and 365 days (± 30 days) post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of intrastent stenosis and/or thrombosis at the target site, as assessed by the Core Lab through DSA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Discharge (up to 3 days post procedure)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean length of hospital stay (from hospital admission and up to hospital discharge) post index procedure

arm_group.arm_group_label: p64/p48 MW HPC Flow Diverter + SAPT

intervention.intervention_name: Endovascular treatment of unruptured aneurysms with p48/p64 MW HPC Flow Modulation Device
intervention.description: Patients suffering from a distal intracranial aneurysm will be treated endovascularly with the p48/p64 MW HPC Flow Modulation Device.
intervention.arm_group_label: p64/p48 MW HPC Flow Diverter + SAPT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. At least 18 years of age.
2. Subject has a saccular, unruptured or recanalized intracranial aneurysm. The subject may also have a previous ruptured aneurysm, provided rupture of this aneurysm 30 days from the index procedure.
3. Subject is intended to be treated for only one target aneurysm during the index procedure except for segmental disease (multiple aneurysms located on the same arterial segment aimed to be treated with one investigational device or investigational telescopic devices).
4. Subject has already been selected for flow diversion therapy as the appropriate treatment.
5. Subject has a target intracranial aneurysm (IA) that has a parent vessel with diameter 1.5-5.0 mm distal/proximal to the target IA.
6. Subject has a mRS ≤ 2 before the procedure, as determined by a certified assessor independent of the index procedure.
7. Subject provides written informed consent verifying the use of his/her data (according to data protection laws).
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject who is currently prescribed under any long lasting antiplatelet and/or anticoagulation medication.
2. Subject has undergone a surgery including endovascular procedures in the last 30 days prior to the study procedure.
3. Subject has had an Intracranial hemorrhage and/or subarachnoid hemorrhage in the past 30 days prior to the study procedure.
4. Subject with target aneurysm previously treated with a stent or flow diverter.
5. Subject is expected to be treated for another aneurysm during the 30 days following the index procedure.
6. Subject with a confirmed stenosis in parent artery.
7. Subject with a blister-like aneurysm, fusiform aneurysm, dissecting aneurysm or aneurysm associated with a brain arteriovenous malformation (AVM).
8. Subject has a pre-procedure mRS >2.
9. Any known contraindication to treatment with the p48/p64 MW HPC Flow Modulation Device in accordance with device IFU.
10. Subject who has undergone stenting of the ipsilateral carotid artery within 3 months of the index procedure.
11. Known serious sensitivity to radiographic contrast agents.
12. Known sensitivity to nickel, titanium metals, or their alloys.
13. Subject already enrolled in other clinical trials (including COATING study) that would interfere with study endpoints.
14. Known renal failure as defined by a serum creatinine > 2.5 mg/dl (or 220 μmol/l) or glomerular filtration rate (GFR) < 30.
15. Subject who has a contraindication to MRI or angiography for whatever reason.
16. Subject with a comorbid disease or condition that would confound the neurological and functional evaluations or compromise survival or ability to complete follow-up assessments.
17. Subject with any known allergy to heparin, ASA or other antiplatelet medications.
18. Pregnant woman or breast feeding.
19. Adults who lack the capacity to provide informed consent, and all those persons deprived of their liberty in prisons or other places of detention.
